text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['18. manazataza ka no anito', '與鬼捕魚', 'Catching fish with a ghost', '', 'si apen Kotan/Manokos (F, 74, Iranmilek)', '謝芹容，女，74，東清村', '']

S.FORM: ko i-panci a ciri-ciring am, ma-ngay ma-naoy sira o tao nokakoa am,
S.TRANSL: 我要講的故事是，古時候的人去捕魚的故事
The story I am about to tell is about a man who went fishing.

S.FORM: “mi ta ma-naza-taza, mo ke-hakay”, mi sira ma-naza-taza am, ni-maka-tey-tey-laod o ji a-cita so moing a, o tao am mi-palit sira, ta am-ian do tey-rala ma-noyo.
S.TRANSL: “朋友，我們去捕魚” ，他們兩個人就一起去捕魚了；鬼（看不見臉的）在靠海的一邊（撈魚），而人類在靠岸的地方趕魚
“Friend, let’s go fishing.” The two of them went fishing.The ghost, (whose face could not be seen), was near the sea [catching fish, and the human stood near the shore herding fish.

S.FORM: a no mi na toyo-en am, ni-man-manma pa o tao a ma-naza,
S.TRANSL: 當他趕魚的時候。應該是人類先拿撈網網魚才對
When the ghost started to drive out the fish, the man would have the net ready.

S.FORM: “toyo rana, ta pa-laod rana, toyo rana o zawang ang” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 人類說“你可以趕魚了，把水溝的魚趕到出海口來！”
“You can start herding the fish now. Herd all the fish into the sea through the channel,” the human said.

S.FORM: mak-among sira am, “ikongo ori o among ta ori, mo ke-hakay ang”,
S.TRANSL: 每當他們撈到魚時，鬼就問“朋友，我們撈到的是什麼魚？”
When they caught some fish, the ghost asked, “What fish did we catch?”

S.FORM: “beken a arawa”, “kong”, “arawa”, “ay, ra-rawa pa ya”,
S.TRANSL: ” “是arawa魚” ，“什麼？” “arawa魚” ，“哎，rarawa魚唷”
“Arawa fish.” “What?” “Arawa fish.” “Oh, so we got rarawa fish.”

S.FORM: “ji ka mi-zi-ziak am” koan na, ka-kozong da sia.
S.TRANSL: 人類說“你不要說出來嘛” ，然後就把魚裝在網袋裡了
“You don’t have to say it,” the human said. The fisherman put the fish in a bag.

S.FORM: mi sia ma-naza do asa ka zawang am, akma sang,
S.TRANSL: 他們到下一個水溝去捕魚時，也跟前述的情形一樣
They went to the next channel to catch fish. What happened was the same.

S.FORM: ta “key! toyo rana” koan na, toyo-en na ori am, to na vowz-a no tao o vanaka am,
S.TRANSL: 人類說“快，趕魚！” ，鬼就把棒子插入水溝裡並將魚趕到人類那裡去，人類則負責撈魚的工作
“Quick, startle the fish!” The ghost stuck the pole into the hole and herded the fish to the human, and the human did the catching.

S.FORM: “am-ian so among ta, mo ke-hakay?”, “a o ya o among ta”,
S.TRANSL: “朋友，我們有沒有捕到魚？” “有啊”
“Friend, did we catch any fish?” “Yes.”

S.FORM: “ikongo o rararay, kakaray koan na am, ikongo o rararay” koan na no tao a.
S.TRANSL: “什麼rararay？要說kakaray，怎麼說成rararay？”
“What rararay? It’s kakaray. How did it become rararay?” the human said.

S.FORM: “a ikongo” koan na no vangkas a, ori a ka-to da ma-naza-taza-n a,
S.TRANSL: “不然怎麼說嘛？” 鬼說，然後他們就繼續捕魚
“How do you say it then?” the ghost said, and they kept fishing.

S.FORM: ma-naza sira am, mak-among sira am, mahabteng,
S.TRANSL: 後來他們又捕到了mahabteng魚
They managed to catch mahabteng fish.

S.FORM: “ikongo o among ta, mo ke-hakay?”, “mahabteng”,
S.TRANSL: “我們捕到什麼魚？” “是mahabteng魚”
“What did we get?” “mahabteng fish.”

S.FORM: “ay, bebeteng pa ya”, ji na pa-payok-a o ngaran no amo-among, inana pa-sala-en na,
S.TRANSL: “哎，我們捕到bebeteng魚唷” ，他都不說準確的魚名，而發奇怪的語音
“Oh, we caught bebeteng fish.” Every time he said the name of a fish, he would pronounce it wrong, and it was always very strange.

S.FORM: ji na pa ni-moni do dang no tao, “asio ka ya, mo ke-hakay a, to mapa-sala so i-panci” koan na, “a ikongo”
S.TRANSL: 但人類起先還沒有懷疑他，只是說“朋友啊，你怎麼總是把每條魚的名字都唸得不正確？” “不然怎麼唸？”
The human wasn’t suspicious yet, only thinking that the other’s pronunciation was strange, and said, “Friend, why do you keep on pronouncing the fish’s names wrong?” “How are they pronounced, then?”

S.FORM: “ikong o among ta ori, mo ke-hakay ang?” “ilek”,
S.TRANSL: “朋友，我們捕到什麼魚？” “ilek魚”
“Friend, what fish did we catch?” “Ilek fish.”

S.FORM: “wo, ay, iilek pa ya”, “a ya ka ma-kongo-kóngo, mo ke-hakay ya, so i-zi-ziak ya?”
S.TRANSL: “喔唷，我們捕到iilek魚唷” ，“朋友，你說什麼話，你是怎麼搞的？”
“Oh, we got iilek fish.” “Friend, what is wrong with you? What happened to your speech?”

S.FORM: to sira mak-among so angsa am, “ikongo ori?” “angsa”,
S.TRANSL: 他們又捕到angsa魚，“那是什麼魚？” “angsa魚”
The next fish was angsa fish. “What fish is that?” “Angsa fish.”

S.FORM: ilan-an na am, “maci-tpeh ya anito, a ikong na ji manci-an o ngara-ngaran no among a, ya ko i-panci a, na pa-sala-en,
S.TRANSL: 人類開始懷疑他，“這個一定是鬼，我明明告訴他魚名，他卻用不同的說法講魚的名字？”
The human started to become suspicious, and thought, “This has to be a ghost, or else why would he pronounce all the fish’s names wrong? He always pronounces it strangely.

S.FORM: beken a oya rana am, anito ya, a ya todey maci-’eza jiaken a” koan na no tao am, to na na lita-i.
S.TRANSL: 這個叫我一起捕魚的一定是個鬼” 人類這麼想，於是就想設計他
The guy who asked me to fish must be a ghost.” Once the man thought of it this way, he started to scheme.

S.FORM: m-oli rana sira am, “hap-en ko o among ta” koan na no anito am,
S.TRANSL: 他們要回家的時候，鬼說“我提我們的魚哦”
On their way back, the ghost said, “Let me carry the fish.”

S.FORM: “ciaha, mo keypong, to ko na ngap-a, tarétarek a, ji rana a-nat ito a, ha-hap o totoyo ta”, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: “沒關係啦，親愛的，還是我提好了，才這些魚，還不至於提不動，你拿趕魚棒吧” ，“好啦”
“It is okay. Let me carry it. There aren’t that many, and it isn’t that heavy. You can carry the fish poking rod.” “Okay.”

S.FORM: karaan am, “yaken rana, mo ke-hakay am, to mo pa-nanal-a yaken do jia, ya ko k-adas-an a, mi ko pa m-obot an” koan na,
S.TRANSL: “朋友，你在這裡等我一下，我大便很急，先去大便一下” 人類說
“Friend, please wait here for me. I need to have a bowel movement badly,” the human said.

S.FORM: ma-níring o tao am, “ciaha, to ko pa-lolo-a, ta ciaha, ta ya m-ian jimo o kawalan”,
S.TRANSL: 人類說“沒關係，我就帶著，因為你那裡有趕魚棒”
“It is okay, I will take it. You still have the bamboo fish poking rod in your hand,” the man said.

S.FORM: mi mozi-mozib am, mi t-om-ayo, ka-ozib na rana am, ma-la-láyo rana o tao a, to ma-la-layo a to ma-la-láyo o tao.
S.TRANSL: 人類躲避去了，藏起來了；看不到鬼後就開始用跑的，他就一直跑，一直跑
The man went away to hide. When the ghost was invisible, the man started to run as hard as he could.

S.FORM: ma-níring o anito am, “a ya pa ji ningi ori, ya rana man-ngo ori a, ya ni-ma-ngay do kasibo?”
S.TRANSL: 鬼說“他在做什麼啊，去（垃圾場）大便這麼久了怎麼還不出來？”
“Why isn’t he back yet? Does it take that long to defecate?”

S.FORM: aháy-in na no anito am, “ka pa ji a-teyka ni-ma-ngay do kasibo a, ka man-ngo do dang ang”,
S.TRANSL: 鬼等的不耐煩了，就喊著“你去大便（垃圾場）還沒好啊，你在那裡做什麼？”
The ghost was impatient with waiting, and shouted, “Are you done yet? What are you doing there?”

S.FORM: ásio o mi-zi-ziak, ni-ma-la-layo rana,
S.TRANSL: 哪有人回應，人早就跑了
The man didn’t respond, for he was already long gone.

S.FORM: “a ya ni-ma-ngay do wajin ori a? mi ko do kasibo koan na ori? ala na na ni-pa-la-layo o among namen ang” koan na am, to na i ngonoc-i.
S.TRANSL: 鬼想“他去哪裡了？他不是說去大便嗎？會不會拿了我們的魚就跑了呢？” 於是就過去看看
“Where did he go? Didn’t he just go to defecate? I wonder if he took the fish and ran,” the ghost thought. He went to check.

S.FORM: ma-ngay am, panoma-en na o mata na do ra-rahan am, ma-veke-vekeh rana manoma do ra-rahan a ma-la-layo a,
S.TRANSL: 一去，眼睛往前方的路上一看，只見那人的背影像顆粒狀一樣的小了，正在前面的路上跑著
As soon as he went and looked, he saw the man had run very far, and he was already disappearing. His figure viewed from behind was as small as a grain.

S.FORM: t-om-anggah sira do Makangin am, am-ian rana do Peysopoan na do toktok na,
S.TRANSL: 人類跑到Makangin處時，鬼也跑到了Peysopoan處的頂端
When the man got to Makangin, the ghost had gotten to the top of Peysopoan.

S.FORM: am-ian do Songit o tao am, am-ian do toktok na a,
S.TRANSL: 人類跑到Songit處時，鬼則追到了某處（Makangin）的頂端
When the man got to Songit, the ghost had gotten to somewhere on the top [of Makangin.

S.FORM: am-ian do Kaspo ito o tao am, am-ian do Songit o vangkas a, to na angna-knam-a oli-an da,
S.TRANSL: 人類跑到Kaspo處時，鬼則追到了Songit處，距離村莊越來越近了
When the man got to Kaspo, the ghost had gotten to Songit. They were nearing the village.

S.FORM: am-ian rana do ka-kamalig-an o tao am, am-ian pa do atoy no viik o vangkas.
S.TRANSL: 人類已跑到船屋區時，鬼也追到了豬檻區
When the man got to the boat houses, the ghost had gotten to the pigsties.

S.FORM: ka-rateng na do vahay da am, “iwang-i o pazezevengan” koan na o mavakes na, ji mi-zi-ziak ori a,
S.TRANSL: 他一到家，就叫太太說“快開門啊！” 可是沒有回應
When he got home, he yelled, “Open the door!” but the wife didn’t respond.

S.FORM: “key, iwang-i, mo ka-bagbag!”, “ikongo ori ang”, to na ngiwáng-i no mavakes na am,
S.TRANSL: “該死的，快開門啊！” 太太一面開門一面說“怎麼了？”
“Shit! Open up!” The wife opened the door and asked, “What’s the matter?”

S.FORM: “key, pa-toktok-i, mo kazapen, ta ya m-ian so anito”, to na pa-toktók-a ori a ka-sle-slet na rana jia so pazezevengan a.
S.TRANSL: “快呀，把門關上，有鬼！” ，他就把門關上並扣上門栓
“Quick! Close the door! There is a ghost!” He closed the door and locked it.

S.FORM: m-ównay am, to da rana a-mizing do sesdepan, am nipapo na onot-an am,
S.TRANSL: 不久，他們聽到前廊有 聲音，那鬼已經跟來了
Not long after, there was a sound at the entrance. The ghost had come.

S.FORM: “wo, si ji mapa-rapa-rapa so ka-raray, si ji mapa-rapa-rapa so ka-raray!” koan no anito a, am ji na ngamizing-a no tao a.
S.TRANSL: 鬼喊著說“不分漁獲給同伴的人！不分漁獲給同伴的人！” 鬼這樣說，但人類不理會鬼
“Greedy man. You don’t share with me (those fish caught by the two of us),” the ghost shouted. The human didn’t pay any attention to the ghost.

S.FORM: to rana andep do vahay da mapi-pa-zeveng rana am, “he, mo na ji manta-n yaken do among ta ori a,
S.TRANSL: 鬼就到他們家裡去，人類卻深鎖著門，鬼說“嘿，我們那些漁獲你怎麼不分給我呢？
The ghost went to their house, but the human locked the door. “Hey, aren’t you giving me any of the fish?” the ghost asked next to the door.

S.FORM: ya mo rana to mimín-a ha-hap-en o among ta ang? mo na ji pa-vonong-a yaken” koan na no anito am,
S.TRANSL: 我們那些漁獲你全拿了，不分給我了嗎？” 鬼說
“Are you going to take all of what we got yourself? None for me?” the ghost said.

S.FORM: ji sia mi-zi-ziak o tao do vahay ori a.
S.TRANSL: 人類在屋裡不吭聲
The human in the house didn’t make a sound.

S.FORM: ma-níring o anito ori am, “si ji mapa-rapa-rapa so ka-raray, ji rana mapa-rapa-rapa so ka-raray,
S.TRANSL: 鬼又說“你這個不與同伴共享的人！與人公有的漁獲，怎麼可以不分給同伴？
“Greedy man, you didn’t share with your partner (the fish we caught together). How could you not share with your partner the fish we caught together?” the ghost said.

S.FORM: ta imo mapi-among so sang a, ka- ji mo rana manta-n niaken, pi-vonong-en ta pa am” koan na am, to sia mi-zí-ziak?
S.TRANSL: 那些漁獲又不是你一個人的，怎麼可以不分給我呢？我們分一分吧” 鬼說，他們哪裡敢講話？
“Did you catch all that yourself? Why don’t you give me some? Why don’t we split it evenly?” They didn’t utter a sound,

S.FORM: pi-pa-ze-zeveng-an da am, pi-pa-toktok-an da ma-nle-slet sira do vahay.
S.TRANSL: 他們只有把門緊緊的關上而已
but they only kept the door closed.

S.FORM: ka-to da rana ngitkéh-an, ji rana ni-mang-lit ori o tao ang,
S.TRANSL: 那人類連衣服也沒有換掉就睡覺了
The human didn’t even change his clothes before he fell asleep.

S.FORM: ni-pa-telem na do soazan a, mi na hap-en am, cita-en na am, ma-daday a ni-ka-sira,
S.TRANSL: 原來他把魚丟到屋裡的某個角落去了，他拿來一看，所有的魚都被切成了半條魚（鬼將每條魚切半拿走了）
He was so anxious when he got home that he had thrown it into a corner somewhere. When he thought of going to look, he saw that the fish had all been split in half.

W.TRANSL: 過去.受焦-動綴-撕開一半

S.FORM: ni-pi-vonong na rana no anito, to na rana ngono-ngonóng-i a pi-vonong-en o among da.
S.TRANSL: 鬼自行分配他們的漁獲，把自己的份拿走了
The ghost had split the fish evenly and took its share already.

W.TRANSL: 虛.疊-虛.自行決定-處焦.虛

S.FORM: mi-ratateng am, “apia o akma so sia a yakan ya, to rana mapi-vonong so among a anito,
S.TRANSL: 後來，人類說“鬼已經分好了漁獲，但這些（跟鬼一起捕的）魚能吃嗎？”
When the human saw the fish, he said, “The ghost has split the fish, Can we eat it [the fish caught with the ghost?”

S.FORM: ori an o panpandan no ni-mang-ha-ha-hap nokakoa a ko i-panci siciaraw ya.
S.TRANSL: 這是關於古時候的人捕魚的故事，我今天就講到這裡
This is the story about a person fishing before. I will end here today.

S.FORM: no to na i nozok-a palo-palo-en o zawang ori no lasakoy ori am, vaoz-en na rana no tao o vanaka da am,
S.TRANSL: 鬼把棒子插入溝中趕魚，人類則在水溝的另一端等著撈魚
The ghost stuck his rod into the hole and started to herd the fish, while the human waited on the other side to catch the fish.

S.FORM: “a ikong ori ang?”, “beken a kakaray” koan na, “ay, rararay pa ya” koan na,
S.TRANSL: “什麼魚？” “是kakaray魚” ，鬼說，“哎，這是rararay魚啊”
“What did we get?” “Kakaray fish.” the ghost repeated,“Oh, we caught rararay fish,”

S.FORM: ma-naza-taza sira am, ma-kman so sang a,
S.TRANSL: 他們繼續捕魚，仍如前述的情形一樣
They continued to catch fish, and the same thing happened.

S.FORM: “ngasa pa ya, ngasa pa ya”.
S.TRANSL: “這是ngasa魚，這是ngasa魚”
“So it’s a ngasa fish. It is a ngasa fish.”

S.FORM: “yaten rana, mo ke-hakay am, hap rana o among ta, m-oli ta rana an?” koan na, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: “朋友，我們呢，回家了，你來拿（提）我們的魚，” ，“好”
“Friend, let’s go home. Would you take the fish?” “Okay.”

S.FORM: ji na a-tenng-i no anito o ka-lita na jia, ka-hap na so totoyo da kawalan a, o among da am, ni-ha-hap no tao.
S.TRANSL: 鬼並不知道人類要設計他。鬼就拿趕魚棒，人類則拿魚
The ghost didn’t know that the human was setting him up. The ghost took the bamboo fish poking rod, and the human took the fish.

S.FORM: “nohon” koan na no anito a, “a ma-key-kai ka, ajey o among ta”,
S.TRANSL: 鬼說“好，你要快點哦！那魚給我拿吧”
“Okay, but please be quick about it. I’ll take the fish,” the ghost said.

S.FORM: “nona ori rana”, to na ngaong-a, mi-lolo sira.
S.TRANSL: “哦，是他！” ，於是就追去，他們一前一後相隨的跑著
“Oh, it’s him!” The ghost started to chase the man, and they ran, one in front, one in back.

S.FORM: ma-dagdag rana ma-yokay rana am, “nona o among namen ori a ko ni-ptad ori am?”
S.TRANSL: 第二天醒來的時候，“啊，對了，我把魚放哪裡去了？”
The second morning when he woke up, “Oh, yeah, where are the fish?”
